info.description: X (Twitter) API for search, Tweets, users, followers, images, media and more. Supports some v1.1 and v2 API endpoints, with more to come in the future!

get.summary: @Deprecated favorites are now known as likes.

parameters.name: maxId
parameters.description: Returns results with an ID less than (that is, older than) or equal to the specified ID.

parameters.name: sinceId
parameters.description: Returns results with an ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID. There are limits to the number of Tweets which can be accessed through the API. If the limit of Tweets has occured since the since_id, the since_id will be forced to the oldest ID available.

post.summary: @Deprecated favorites are now known as likes.

parameters.name: maxId
parameters.description: Returns results with an ID less than (that is, older than) or equal to the specified ID.

parameters.name: sinceId
parameters.description: Returns results with an ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID. There are limits to the number of Tweets which can be accessed through the API. If the limit of Tweets has occured since the since_id, the since_id will be forced to the oldest ID available.

get.description: Returns a collection of up to 100 user IDs belonging to users who have retweeted the Tweet specified by the id parameter. See details https://developer.x.com/en/docs/twitter-api/v1/tweets/post-and-engage/api-reference/get-statuses-retweeters-ids

post.description: Returns a collection of up to 100 user IDs belonging to users who have retweeted the Tweet specified by the id parameter. See details https://developer.x.com/en/docs/twitter-api/v1/tweets/post-and-engage/api-reference/get-statuses-retweeters-ids

parameters.name: any
parameters.description: Any of these words (Example: cats dogs  contains either cats or dogs (or both))

parameters.name: likes
parameters.description: Minimum likes (Example: 280  Tweets with at least 280 likes))

parameters.name: mentioning
parameters.description: Mentioning these accounts (Example: @SFBART @Caltrain  mentions @SFBART or mentions @Caltrain)

parameters.name: none
parameters.description: None of these words (Example: cats dogs  does not contain cats and does not contain dogs)

parameters.name: phrase
parameters.description: This exact phrase (Example: happy hour  contains the exact phrase happy hour)

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: product type (Top  Latest  People  Media  Lists)

parameters.name: replies
parameters.description: Minimum replies (Example: 280  Tweets with at least 280 replies)

parameters.name: retweets
parameters.description: Minimum retweets (Example: 280  Tweets with at least 280 likes)

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: To these accounts (Example: @Twitter  sent in reply to @Twitter)

get.summary: (bsc) tokenSync when x-rate-limit-reset<9 or there is an error code

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: When twitter returns an error code(429, 401,403,503.) pass the error code into this parameter. When x-rate-limit-remaining is less than 9, pass in 1

parameters.name: resetTime
parameters.description: When x-rate-limit-remaining is less than 9, you need to obtain x-rate-limit-reset and pass in the resetTime parameter

post.summary: (bsc) tokenSync when x-rate-limit-reset<9 or there is an error code

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: When twitter returns an error code(429, 401,403,503.) pass the error code into this parameter. When x-rate-limit-remaining is less than 9, pass in 1

parameters.name: resetTime
parameters.description: When x-rate-limit-remaining is less than 9, you need to obtain x-rate-limit-reset and pass in the resetTime parameter
